medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation for ocular and renal findings related to papillorenal syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The condition was first presented in a 4-month-old female infant who exhibited nystagmus and poor vision. Symptoms began prenatally with reduced kidney size noted on ultrasonography at 38 weeks. Postnatal evaluation indicated poor light response in the right eye and visual field defects corresponding to retinal perfusion issues.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The infant was hospitalized for 36 hours after birth due to hypoglycemia. The mother showed no ocular issues, while the father had uncorrected visual acuity of 20/15 but exhibited optic disc abnormalities.
medical_history.family_history: The report indicates a family history of renal abnormalities and recurrent pyelonephritis in several family members, including sisters with recurrent pyelonephritis and renal stones. The mother's history includes poor vision and renal issues as well.
